text: Shirred eggs (also known as baked eggs, or in ) are eggs cooked in a manner which results in a firm white but soft or runny yolk. The name comes from the dish in which the eggs are cooked. == Process == The eggs are placed in small dishes called ramekins with a knob of butter on top and baked at 180°C (350°F) until the white is set, but the yolk remains soft, which takes around 15 minutes. == Variations == Variations involve replacing the butter with various types of cream. Provence and Normandy have their own versions. == Related pages == * Boiled egg#Soft-boiled eggs == More reading == * Category:Egg dishes
title: Shirred eggs
